title: Mathematics Instructional Design Strategies Using the ARCS Motivation Model

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary mathematics foundational knowledge, self-directed learning experience
context.additional_context: Professionals (medical/legal/technical) requiring workplace-linked mathematical competency enhancement, with content optimized for smartphone-based learning environments

learning_goals: Learners can apply the four elements of the ARCS model (Attention, Relevance, Confidence, Satisfaction) to the design of mathematics instruction
Learners can create motivational mathematics instructional materials using smartphones in a restricted technology environment
Learners can iteratively improve their instructional design strategies through formative assessment

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
